content.text: As a client, I want the ability to set distinct time-off policies for various time-off types. This ensures flexibility in managing accrued and lump-sum time-off for different categories.
Monthly paycheck: 10/12 days per period (0.8333 day)
Semi Monthly paycheck: 10/24 days per period (0.4166 day)
Monthly paycheck: 15/12 days per period (1.2500 day)
Semi Monthly paycheck: 15/24 days per period (0.6250 day)
Monthly paycheck: 20/12 days per period (1.6666 day)
Semi Monthly paycheck: 20/24 days per period (0.8333 day)
** Supervisor’s approval part will be handled in a future story.
Yes. The maximum accumulation is 60 days.
To be determined - prerequisite: 12 month of work-time (perhaps Client Admin puts a check mark in employee setting for eligiblity)
** Note: Currently, the client is doing accrual based on # of days. The client is considering to change this to paycheck periods. The client has two pay check periods: monthly and semi-monthly.

fields.summary: Configuring Time-off Policies for Different Time-off Types

content.text: As a full-time user, I want to see my time-off overview within the Time-Off Module. This functionality allows me to conveniently check my current balance and remaining time-off days.
Full-time employee can see this overview section or interface.
Overview Data - Each Employee for each employee’s CURRENT TERM
Employment Date & Current Year - Employment Date -1 & Next Year
Employee’s Yearly Total Sick Leave Days
*All WI employees have 5 days of Sick Leave
Employee’s total sick leave days used during the current time-off period
Total Sick Leave - Sick Leave Used
Employee’s Yearly Total Personal Time Days
*All WI employees have 5 days of Personal Time
Employee’s total personal time used during the current time-off period
Total Personal Time - Personal Time Used
Employee’s total vacation days used during the current time-off period

Select Start Date and End Date (Date Picker)

Feb 08 - Feb 08, 1 day can become 0.5, but not 1.5
Feb 08 - Feb 09, 2 days can be changed to 1.5, but not 2.5
Feb 08 - Feb 12, 3 days can be changed to 2.5, but not 3

content.text: As a client admin, I want the HR Danbi system to automatically send an email notification to an employee's supervisor when the employee submits a time-off request. This notification will keep supervisors informed and facilitate timely approval or denial.
An email is sent to the employee’s supervisor with the followings:
HR Danbi - New Time-off Request from {EmployeeName}
HR Danbi - New Time-off Request from Harvey Oh
Please use the following link to approve or deny the request.
Please use the following link to approve or deny the request.

content.text: As a full-time employee, I want the functionality to see my time-off requests along with their status in the Time-Off Module. This feature provides me with a history of all my requests, including whether they are approved, pending, or denied.
All full-time employee can see this section or interface.
The Time-Off Module should include a dedicated section or interface where employees can view their time-off request history.
The interface should display a list of all time-off requests made by the employee, showing details such as request dates, request days/hours, time-off type, and the status.
Each time-off request entry should include a clear status indicator (e.g., approved, pending, denied) for quick reference.
Clicking on a specific time-off request should provide detailed information, including the dates, time-off type, and any comments or notes from supervisor.

fields.summary: Viewing Time-off Request History with Status

issuetype.description: Stories track functionality or features expressed as user goals.
issuetype.name: Story

issuetype.description: Epics track collections of related bugs, stories, and tasks.
issuetype.name: Epic

nonEditableReason.message: The Parent Link is only available to Jira Premium users.

content.text: As a full-time employee and supervisor, I want the functionality to see all the time-off requests of my supervisees within the Time-Off Module. This feature will provide a centralized view for efficient review and decision-making.
Only full-time supervisor can see view this section or dashboard
The Time-Off Module should include a dedicated section or dashboard for supervisors, displaying all time-off requests from their supervisees.
The dashboard should present a clear list of time-off requests, including details such as requester name, requested dates, requested days, status, and time-off type.
The dashboard should provide quick access to detailed information about each pending time-off request for thorough review.
Supervisors should be able to take actions directly from the dashboard, such as approving or denying time-off requests.

fields.summary: Viewing Time-off Requests of Supervisees in the Time-off Module

content.text: As an employee, I want the functionality to see my timesheet submissions along with their status in the Timesheet Module. This feature provides me with a history of all my submissions, including whether they are approved, pending, or denied.
The Timesheet Module should include a dedicated section or interface where employees can view their timesheet submission history.
The interface should display a list of all timesheet submissions made by the employee, showing details such as submission dates, hours, and the status.
Each timesheet submission entry should include a clear status indicator (e.g., approved, saved, pending, denied) for quick reference.
Clicking on a specific timesheet submission should provide detailed information, including the dates, hours, tasks, and any comments or notes from supervisor.

is greater than the remaining hours, do not allow request submission.
